title: Truly too much true damage in this game
body:
BEFORE YOU READ ANY FURTHER PLEASE NOTE; **I DO NOT THINK THAT VAYNE IS OVERPOWERED**

So here I am, playing Alistar support vs Vayne adc (Jax top/ Udyr jg LOTS of AA focused champs)... I build {{item:3110}} {{item:3082}}  to lower her attack speed and build up some armor... and wowee!

Still died in about 6 auto attacks with my ulti going.. took 1/4 my total dmg as true dmg over the course of the game.

Honest question here; what am I supposed to do as a tank to mitigate the amount of true damage in this game right now? It feels straight up awful that nothing I do can stop someone using conqueror or having some native true damage built into their kits who gets a slight lead.

It's true what they say there is truly too much true damage in this game, and the true solution is less true damage.

EDIT: I had {{item:3047}} {{item:3401}} built as well.. and I am looking for what items i could have built to be more tanky tanky

EDIT 2: I didn't realize her passive dealt %hp true dmg as well.. so even if I build HP it wont lower her true damage.. looking like my options for counter play are dwindling pretty quickly if i cant build armor, hp, or attack speed debuffs to keep her from gibbing me in 4.5 seconds. 

EDIT 3: I don't want this to devolve into a jircle cerk over vayne/yi/trynd/other true dmg champs specifically.. i understand they all have "counterplay" (sigh)... I'm talking about the sheer prevalence of true dmg in this game and how as a tank you have literally no way to mitigate that dmg and it feels awful to build full tank and die nearly instantly to a champ with true dmg.

First off, the whole thing you're trying to talk about from the beginning is completely out of context, and you're also being quite hyperbolic.

Over the course of an entire game, roughly 75-80% of Vayne's total damage dealt to champions will by physical, or at least this used to be a commonly quoted and parroted statistic before rageblade got reworked.  Now, with a rageblade build, its closer to 60-75%, but nowhere near 90% as you erroneously claim.

Second, that is average across all champions in that game, over all game stages.  As she leaves laning phase, gets more attack speed, and ranks up W more, a higher percentage of her damage will be true damage.  Additionally, as the true damage has no flat component, but she gets flat AD steroids, has base damage on items and abilities, and also the fact that squisher targets have less armor, so they mitigate less physical damage while also having less health to begin with means they take a disproportionately high amount of physical damage relative to Vayne's actual damage output. 

Consider then, that Vayne will optimally be targeting squishies as much as possible, and tanks as little as possible (out right avoiding them until other targets are dealt with if she can) so the percentage of her damage averaged across the game and across all targets will not be even representative of her average damage between enemy champions on average, as it will be a weighted and heavily skewed distribution towards your bot lane and less so towards the jungler.

Then, additionally consider that tanks have more armor, so a higher physical damage reduction, while also having more health, so Vayne's true damage is already significantly more to tanks from their own HP stat alone, but Vayne's physical damage is also less.  As a result, it is not uncommon to see Vayne doing 40-60% true damage to tanks, 30-50% physical, and roughly 5-10% in magic damage from shiv, runes, etc.

Against a tank, her Q tickles, her W procs, however, are massive nukes.

All that propaganda ignores one major blaring thing: Although Attack speed and Guinsoo's procs may increase the rate of her W proccing, there's still the same number of physical attacks in between, and her Q has a friggin 2 second cooldown, and is ENTIRELY why her kit works.... Q is what stealths her. Q is what does near double damage. Q is what repositions her to be able to E and wall knock. 

In other words, attack speed plays a very little role in the Phys damage/True damage ratio, because the rate of fire is always 3 to proc, and Q is spammable.

The only thing that really changes the ratio of Phys to True...... is Armor, and the amount of HP she is versus. (High HP = more true damage while armor = less phys damage).

There is a lot of true damage in this game, but I have a hard time taking that statement seriously from people who play tanks because it implies that they believe they should just last forever and nothing should counter them.

DPS champions are supposed to melt tanks late game. Tanks are only supposed to absorb a lot of AP damage.

Vayne's whole thing is she's meant to be a tank buster, so she's your counter. You can and should build against her, but if she's doing well then you need to lock her down an have an assassin delete her.

Expecting to go toe to toe with a Vayne late game as Alistar isn't very realistic. It would be better to build AP in that situation because you're not going to win the fight by simply outsustaining her damage like you would with most other match ups.
